headline: Bristol-Myers gets 'potentially revolutionary medicine' in MyoKardia deal, CEO says
summary: "MyoKardia is an important company because they developed a really interesting approach to the treatment of cardiovascular disease," Bristol-Myers Squibb CEO Giovanni Caforio said.

headline: 'I think what we got today was the removal of uncertainty,' Jim Cramer says
summary: "There's nothing the market hates more than uncertainty — take it away and stocks go higher," the "Mad Money" host said.

headline: Sonos stock drops on report that Apple is purging third-party audio products from its stores
summary: Apple manufactures a variety of audio products under its Beats brand as well as products such as AirPods wireless earbuds and the HomePod smart speaker under the main Apple brand.
The report is expected to conclude the more than year-long investigation into Apple, Amazon, Facebook and Google, and will suggest potential areas for reform in the antitrust laws.
headline: New information about Facebook's Instagram acquisition delayed House antitrust report, source says
Lobbying in Q1 topped a record $938 million, but lobbyists say their profession is misunderstood
summary: The lobbying industry, worth more than $3.5 billion, is arguably the U.S. government's oldest profession and is protected by the First Amendment. Yet critics say it undermines the country's democracy by tilting influencing power in the favor of those with unlimited financial resources.

headline: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Alteryx, Iovance Biotherapeutics & more
summary: Take a look at the companies making headlines in after-hours trading.

headline: 'Dune' release date reportedly pushed back to October 2021
summary: The release date of sci-fi epic "Dune" has been delayed until next October, according to Deadline.

headline: Trump's coronavirus infection and signs of economic weakness pose re-election challenges
summary: Trump's path to re-election hinges largely on the trajectory of the coronavirus and its impact on the national economy, and he's gotten unsettling news about both lately.

headline: Covid 'Long-Haulers' and Their Lingering Medical Bills
Regal Cinemas closing all U.S. theaters because it really needs the blockbusters, CEO says
summary: "We are now like a kind of a grocery shop that have no food to sell," Cineworld CEO Mooky Greidinger told CNBC.

headline: Here’s how much health insurance costs if you retire early
AMC stock falls 10% as rival Cineworld closes movie theaters
summary: On Friday, S&P Global Ratings lowered its issuer credit rating on AMC from CCC+ to CCC-, saying that the company's cash burn could accelerate as it reopens venues.
CNBC's Jim Cramer said Monday that he was optimistic about negotiations for another relief package for the U.S. economy.
headline: Cramer says 'I wouldn't bet against this market right now,' holds out hope for more stimulus

summary: Dr. Carolyn McClanahan shares questions to help you understand how common health issues and health-care policy can affect finances.
headline: Do you understand how your health can affect your finances? Take this quiz to find out

summary: Uncertainty in Washington is keeping Wall Street on edge. Piper Sandler chief market technician Craig Johnson charts the S&P 500 and how it could swing from now until Election Day.
headline: With one month until the presidential election, Piper Sandler analyst plots S&P 500's key levels
Nvidia pledges to build Britain’s largest supercomputer following $40 billion bid for Arm
summary: Nvidia has announced plans to build a £40 million ($52 million) supercomputer in Cambridge, England, weeks after saying it intends to buy British rival Arm for $40 billion.

headline: The stock market appears to be coiling for a tension release
Ride-hailing app Ola banned in London over safety concerns, shortly after Uber wins reprieve
summary: Indian ride-hailing app Ola has been banned by London transport regulator TfL over public safety concerns.

headline: Dow futures rise 150 points in overnight trading as investors monitor Trump's health
summary: Investors brace for another volatile week with President Donald Trump's hospitalization adding more uncertainty to the market outlook ahead of Election Day.

headline: Market bull reveals two risks keeping him up at night and why they may alter his forecast
summary: Federated Hermes’ Phil Orlando signals his bull case may be on borrowed time.
